Package com.visionspace.taskmanager

Class TaskManagerTest

java.lang.Object
com.visionspace.taskmanager.TaskManagerTest
Direct Known Subclasses:
LocalTaskManagerTest
public abstract class TaskManagerTest
extends java.lang.Object
Tests to check that a given TaskManager instance implements the interface contract. Tested instances are tested with its dependencies as instantiated in TaskManagerFactory, with no mocked dependencies, and therefore provide also some coverage for the task manager dependencies (namely, the used task store and task launcher.

This class is expected to have a derived class for each class implementing the tested interface, that may add test scenarios specific to that implementation.

Note: Tests avoid checking time-dependent behaviors to the extent possible, but on some cases it was not possible to eliminate it. In theory such tests may lead to false positives on machines under extreme load; however, it was considered preferable to keep them anyway, as it is preferable to have more coverage than eliminating (theoretical) false positives.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    protected abstract TaskManager createSingleThreadedTaskManager()
    Creates a task manager that is able to run only a task at a time.
    protected abstract TaskManager createTaskManager()
    Creates the default task manager to use in tests.
    void setup()  
    void testActionErrorHasNoSideEffects()
    Checks that an error in a task doesn't interfere with other actions, and that the state is correctly set in the task store.
    void testCancelActionAfterRunning()
    Checks that attempts to cancel an action after it is complete with success fail.
    void testCancelActionBeforeRunning()
    Checks that a scheduled action cancelled before its scheduled time is not executed and that it's state is updated as expected.
    void testCancelRunningAction()
    Checks that cancelling a running task triggers an interrupt in the thread where the task is running (thus causing the action to fail if the interrupt flag is checked) and the task to change to cancelled state.
    void testScheduledActionRunsAtScheduledTime()
    Checks that a task scheduled to run at a given time (i) get executed and (ii) it is not executed before the scheduled time.
    void testScheduledTasksInParallel()
    Checks that two tasks scheduled to run at the same time don't run in sequence.
    void testScheduleWithValidationError()
    Checks that attempts to schedule an action with a validation error are rejected, with no task being added to the task store.
    void testSchedulingOrderIndependence()
    Checks that the order scheduled tasks are executed depends only on the intended scheduled time, regardless of the order tasks are submitted.
    void testWaitForFailedTask()
    Checks the TaskHandle.waitForExecution(long) operation when it is invoked while a task is running and it fails.
    void testWaitForFinishedTask()
    Checks the TaskHandle.waitForExecution(long) operation when it is invoked after a task finishes.
    void testWaitForQueuedTask()
    Checks the TaskHandle.waitForExecution(long) operation when it is invoked while a task is scheduled.
    void testWaitForRunningTask()
    Checks the TaskHandle.waitForExecution(long) operation when it is invoked while a task is running.
    void testWithMaxWaitTimeExpired()
    Checks that tasks configured with a maximum queue time fail if they stay in the queue for longer than the configured maximum.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • testScheduledTasksInParallel

      public void testScheduledTasksInParallel() throws java.lang.InterruptedException
      Checks that two tasks scheduled to run at the same time don't run in sequence. Assumes the task executor has at least 2 worker threads.
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException
